com.topcoder.message.email
Class EmailEngine

java.lang.Object
  com.topcoder.message.email.EmailEngine
All Implemented Interfaces:
com.topcoder.util.config.ConfigManagerInterface
public class EmailEngine
extends java.lang.Object
implements com.topcoder.util.config.ConfigManagerInterface

The EmailEngine class is responsible for sending email.

Version 3.0 has added support for priority messages via message headers.

In version 3.1, the send methods are updated to handle the content type property from TCSEmailMethod, and an explicit default constructor is added to be consistent with current TC standards. The changes have no effect on the thread safety of any method.

Version:
3.1
Author:
sord, BEHiker57W, smell, TCSDEVELOPER

Method Detail

send

public static void send(TCSEmailMessage message)
                 throws com.topcoder.util.config.ConfigManagerException,
                        SendingException

Sends an email message.

The email message must contain at least one primary address, otherwise IllegalArgumentException will be thrown. The method attempts to send the message via the internally configured SMTP settings.

Version 3.0 of Email Engine have added message header support for priority messages.

Version 3.1 of Email Engine have added content type support

Parameters:
message - the email message to be sent
Throws:
java.lang.NullPointerException - if message is null
java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if there is no to address or no from address associated with the message
com.topcoder.util.config.ConfigManagerException - if there is a problem with configuration
SendingException - if message could not be send properly to the remote server

send

protected static void send(javax.mail.Address from,
                           javax.mail.Address[] to,
                           javax.mail.Address[] cc,
                           javax.mail.Address[] bcc,
                           java.lang.String subject,
                           java.lang.String data,
                           java.lang.String contentType,
                           java.util.Map attachments,
                           java.util.Map headers)
                    throws com.topcoder.util.config.ConfigManagerException,
                           SendingException

This method actually contacts a SMTP server and transmits the message.

It first tries to get the configuration of the SMTP server via ConfigManager. In case the search for configuration fails, the default configuration will be used instead.

Version 3.0 of Email Engine have added support for priority messages. The priority of message is implemented as message headers and the headers are passed as parameter in the headers Map.

Version 3.1 of Email Engine have added content type support

Parameters:
from - the From address
to - the To addresses
cc - the CC addresses
bcc - the BCC addresses
subject - the message subject
data - the message body
attachments - all message attachments
headers - the custom headers to set for the message, as defined in TCSEmailMessage. No headers if the map is null or empty
contentType - the message content type, for example "text/plain
Throws:
java.lang.NullPointerException - if any of from, to, subject, contentType, data or attachments is null
com.topcoder.util.config.ConfigManagerException - if the engine cannot load properties from the ConfigManager
SendingException - if there is a problem sending the message to the server
Since:
3.0
